title: ICE - Panic while cross-compiling for i686/x86_64-unknown-uefi

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
Must be compiled with nightly as `build-std=core` is used for cargo. ### Code `lib.rs`: ``` #![no_std] pub fn pass_array(data: &[u8; 16]) {} pub struct S { data: (), } fn work(s: &S) { pass_array( unsafe { &*(s.data as *const _ as *const [u8; 16]) // Correct syntax (& compiler works properly): // &*(&s.data as *const _ as *const [u8; 16]) } ); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.46.0-nightly (346aec9b0 2020-07-11) binary: rustc commit-hash: 346aec9b02f3c74f3fce97fd6bda24709d220e49 commit-date: 2020-07-11 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.46.0-nightly LLVM version: 10.0 ``` Commands: ``` cargo build -Z unstable-options -Z build-std=core --target=i686-unknown-uefi cargo build -Z unstable-options -Z build-std=core --release --target=i686-unknown-uefi cargo build -Z unstable-options -Z build-std=core --target=x86_64-unknown-uefi cargo build -Z unstable-options -Z build-std=core --release --target=x86_64-unknown-uefi ``` ### Error output On debug: ``` error: internal compiler error: src\librustc_middle\ich\impls_ty.rs:167:9: ty::TyKind::hash_stable() - can't hash a TyVid _#1t. ``` On release: ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 1', C:\Users\VssAdministrator\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\ena-0.14.0\src\snapshot_vec.rs:199:10 ``` **...** ``` note: rustc 1.46.0-nightly (346aec9b0 2020-07-11) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -Z unstable-options -C opt-level=3 -C linker-plugin-lto --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden ```
Backtrace

On debug: ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src\librustc_errors\lib.rs:916:9 stack backtrace: 0: ::fmt 1: core::fmt::write 2: ::fmt 3: std::panicking::take_hook 4: std::panicking::take_hook 5: rustc_driver::report_ice 6: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook 7: ::fmt 8: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::err_count 9: rustc_errors::Handler::bug 10: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 11: ::fmt 12: ::fmt 13: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 14: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 15: rustc_middle::ich::impls_ty:: for rustc_middle::ty::sty::TyVid>::hash_stable 16: ZN12rustc_middle2ty3sty108_DERIVE_rustc_data_structures_stable_hasher_HashStable_rustc_middle_ich_StableHashingContext_ctx_FOR_InferTy161_$LT$impl$u20$rustc_data_structures..stable_hasher..HashStable$LT$rustc_middle..ich..hcx..StableHashingContext$GT$$u20 17: ::visit_item 30: ::fmt 31: ::fmt 32: ::fmt 33: ::visit_impl_item 34: rustc_typeck::check_crate 35: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::print_stats 36: ::fmt 37: ::partial_relro 38: hidden query stack during panic: #0 [type_implements_trait] evaluating `type_implements_trait` `(DefId(1:1851 ~ core[aabf]::convert[0]::From[0]), *const _, [()], ParamEnv { caller_bounds: [], reveal: UserFacing, def_id: None })` #1 [typeck_tables_of] type-checking `work` #2 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack
